p:
The migration of livestock viruses could be mainly caused by trading
11 , although migrant birds might be able to transport avian viruses to chickens in some cases
19 . However, if such transfers occur frequently, the characteristics of specific areas would disappear, and viruses would be better distributed worldwide; in particular, Europe should have viruses that originated in other areas (Fig.Â S2). Therefore, viruses of livestock would be transmitted rarely by migrant birds.
